name: EHDSSpecimen
title: Specimen model
description: EHDS refined base model for A sample to be used for Analysis

element.short: Specimen model
element.definition: EHDS refined base model for A sample to be used for Analysis

element.short: An identifier of the specimen which is unique within in a defined scope.
element.definition: An identifier of the specimen which is unique within in a defined scope. Example: identifier assigned by ordering system, identifier assigned by laboratory etc. Multiple identifiers can be used.

element.short: Biologic type of species for laboratory result reports bound to non-human subjects.
element.definition: Biologic type of species for laboratory result reports bound to non-human subjects.

element.short: Material that forms the specimen.
element.definition: Material that forms the specimen.

element.short: The period or date and time of specimen collection.
element.definition: The period or date and time of specimen collection.

element.short: Anatomic location (body location, laterality) where the material is collected, e.g. Elbow, left
element.definition: Anatomic location (body location, laterality) where the material is collected, e.g. Elbow, left

element.short: Morphological abnormalities of the anatomical location where the material is taken, for example wound, ulcer.
element.definition: Morphological abnormalities of the anatomical location where the material is taken, for example wound, ulcer.

element.short: Source device in case the material is not collected directly from the patient but comes from a patient-related object, e.g. a catheter
element.definition: Source device in case the material is not collected directly from the patient but comes from a patient-related object, e.g. a catheter

element.short: The procedure that collects the specimen.
element.definition: The procedure that collects the specimen.

element.short: Collection procedure method
element.definition: If relevant for the results, the method of obtaining the specimen.

element.short: Date and time that the material is handed over at the laboratory or specimen collection centre.
element.definition: Date and time that the material is handed over at the laboratory or specimen collection centre.

element.short: Subject
element.definition: Where the specimen came from. This may be from patient(s), from a location (e.g., the source of an environmental sample), or a sampling of a substance, a biologically-derived product, or a device.

element.short: The container holding the specimen.
element.definition: The container holding the specimen.

element.short: Specimen quantity
element.definition: Quantity of specimen within container.

element.short: Container device
element.definition: The device resource for the the container holding the specimen.
